Absolute Value.Description: Outputs the magnitude of the number. Is always positive.

Acos.Description: Computes the arccosine of a number.

Consumable Activate.Description: Sets the input consumable to active. Use this to confirm a consumable used event. Can also be used independently. Displays the consumable as active in the backback and decreases the number of comsumables the player owns.

Add Currency.Description: Adds some amount to the Player's balance of one room currency. Configure this chip to set the affected currency.

Add.Description: Computes the sum of two or more inputs.

Add Tag.Description: Adds a tag to the input object or player.

Add Tags.Description: Adds tags to the input object or player.

AI Get Line of Sight Parameters.Description: Outputs the current line of sight parameters from the input AI.

AI Get Target.Description: Outputs the current combat target of an inputted AI.

AI Has Line of Sight To Target.Description: Outputs if the input AI has line of sight to the input target.

AI Look At.Description: Command an AI to look at the input target. If you want the AI to look in a passed in vector as a direction, set the “Look Target Is Direction” parameter to True. To make an AI stop looking, use the AI Stop Looking node.

AI Path To.Description: Commands the AI to path to the input target destination.

AI Rotate.Description: Commands an AI to turn an inputted number of degrees. To command the AI to back to default rotating behavior, use the AI Stop Looking node.

AI Set Line of Sight Parameters.Description: Sets an AI’s various LoS paramters. The “Cone” setting acts like a vision cone that sits in front of AIs like eyes, where the “Circle” setting acts like a radius around the AI. The Require LoS For Targetting parameter defines if AIs can see you through walls.

AI Set Pathing Speed.Description: Sets the speed for an inputted AI. This same setting can be determined by configuring the AI itself.

AI Set Target.Description: Sets the input AI’s current target.

AI Start Combat Behavior.Description: RRO Quest AI black box. This node tells the input AI to start their C# defined combat behavior. Note: this behavior varies per AI.

AI Stop Combat Behavior.Description: Tells the input AI to stop its C# defined combat behavior.

AI Stop Looking.Description: Command the input AI to cancel its current Rotate and Look At commands. Call this before telling an AI to path after having it Rotate/Look At so it rotates properly while moving again.

Ambience.Description: Choose from a selection of ambient audio tracks, for use with the Audio Player.

And.Description: Outputs True when all inputs are True. If any input is False, it outputs False.

Angular Velocity Add.Description: Add angular velocity to an object. The Angular Velocity vector should lie along the axis of the rotation being added, with a magnitude that (once multiplied by the speed multiplier) represents the clockwise rotation speed in deg/s. Once the new angular velocity has been computed, its speed will be capped by the Max Angular Speed.

Angular Velocity Set.Description: Sets the angular velocity of an object. The Angular Velocity vector should lie along the axis of rotation, with a magnitude that (once multiplied by the speed multiplier) represents the clockwise rotation speed in deg/s.

Asin.Description: Computes the arcsine of a number.

Atan2.Description: Computes the 2-argument arctangent of a number.

Atan.Description: Computes the arctangent of a number.

Audio Get Length.Description: Returns the length in seconds of the given audio reference.

Audio Player Get Audio.Description: Returns the most recent audio reference that the target Audio Player has started playing.

Audio Player Get Max Rolloff Distance.Description: Returns the furthest distance from the target Audio Player that the audio can be heard from.

Audio Player Get Playing.Description: Returns True if the target Audio Player is playing.

Audio Player Get Speed.Description: Returns the speed multiplier of the target Audio Player.

Audio Player Get Time Stamp.Description: Returns the current time stamp of the target Audio Player in seconds.

Audio Player Get Volume.Description: Returns the volume multiplier of the target Audio Player.

Audio Player Set Max Rolloff Distance.Description: Sets the maximum distance that audio from the target Audio Player can be heard from.

Audio Player Set Speed.Description: Sets the speed multiplier that the target Audio Player will play at.

Audio Player Set Time Stamp.Description: Sets the time stamp of the target Audio Player in seconds.

Audio Player Set Volume.Description: Sets the volume multiplier that the target Audio Player will play at.

Background Objects Constant.Description: Defines values for the room's background objects.

Beacon Get Color.Description: Returns the color of the target Beacon object.

Beacon Get Enabled.Description: Outputs True if the target Beacon object is enabled.

Beacon Get Height.Description: Returns the height of the target Beacon object.

Beacon Set Color.Description: Sets the color of the target Beacon object.

Beacon Set Enabled.Description: Sets the enabled state of the target Beacon object.

Beacon Set Height.Description: Sets the height of the target Beacon object.

Bit And.Description: Computes a bitwise AND. The result has a bit set for every bit that is set in both of the inputs.

Bit Leading Zeros.Description: Counts the number of zeros at the beginning (most significant side) of the binary representation of an integer.

Bit Nand.Description: Computes a bitwise NAND. (NOT AND) The result has a bit set for every bit that is not set in either of the inputs.

Bit Not.Description: Computes a bitwise NOT. The result has a bit set for every bit that is not set in the input.

Bit Or.Description: Computes a bitwise OR. The result has a bit set for every bit that is set in either of the inputs.

Bit Pop Count.Description: Counts the number of set bits in the binary representation of an integer.

Bit Rotate Left.Description: Rotates digits in the binary representation of an integer to the left. As the leftmost bits fall off, they are used to fill the rightmost bits.

Bit Rotate Right.Description: Rotates digits in the binary representation of an integer to the right. As the rightmost bits fall off, they are used to fill the leftmost bits.

Bit Shift Left.Description: Shifts a value left by a number of bits. Leftmost bits are discarded, and rightmost bits are filled with zeros.

Inputs.Name: Shift
Inputs.Description: Shift count. The actual shift performed will be this value mod 32.

Bit Shift Right.Description: Shifts a value right by a number of bits. Rightmost bits are discarded, and leftmost bits are filled with zeros. (Logical shift)

Inputs.Name: Shift
Inputs.Description: Shift count. The actual shift performed will be this value mod 32.

Bit Trailing Zeros.Description: Counts the number of zeros at the end (least significant side) of the binary representation of an integer.

Bit Xor.Description: Computes a bitwise XOR. The result has a bit set for every bit that is set in exactly one of the inputs.

bool Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

If.Description: Takes a boolean condition as an input. If True, the "Then" exec pin fires. If False, the "Else" exec pin fires.

Button Get Is Pressed.Description: Outputs a target Button's Pressed property.

Button Get Text.Description: Outputs a target Button's Text property.

Button Set Text.Description: Sets an input Button's Text property.

Ceil.Description: Returns the least integral value greater than or equal to the input value.

Ceil to Int.Description: Returns the smallest integer value greater than or equal to the input value.

Circuit Board.Description: Use as a way to encapsulate your logic. You can have as many inputs and outputs as you like. Use the Edit tool to open up the Circuit Board and add nodes inside it to encapsulate the logic. Hit done editing on your Maker Pen to leave the Circuit Board context.

Clamp.Description: Clamps a value between a minimum value and maximum value. If the minimum is greater than the maximum, the minimum value will always be returned no matter the input.

Clear Player Vignette.Description: Clears any active screen vignette on the given player.

Clear Player World UI.Description: Clear the UI configuration displayed above a given player.

Player Clear Current Subtitle.Description: Clears any subtitle which is currently being displayed for the given player.

Collision Data Get Distance.Description: Gets distance in meters of an object/player from center specified in "Overlap Sphere" chip.

Collision Data Get Normal.Description: Gets unit vector specifying the direction of an object/player from center specified in "Overlap Sphere" chip.

Collision Data Get Object.Description: Gets object of a collision data (or null for players) returned from "Overlap Sphere" chip.

Collision Data Get Player.Description: Gets player of a collision data (or null for objects) returned from "Overlap Sphere" chip.

Collision Data Get Position.Description: Gets position of an object/player returned by "Overlap Sphere" chip.

Color Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

Combatant Get Ground Position.Description: Outputs the ground position of an input combatant.

Combatant Get Health.Description: Outputs the Health property of the input combatant.

Combatant Get Is Alive.Description: Outputs True if the input combatant is alive.

Combatant Get Velocity.Description: Outputs the input combatant's current velocity and speed.

Combatant Receive Damage.Description: Deals damage to the given target combatant with various parameters.

Combatant Set Health.Description: Sets the Health property of an input combatant.

Combatant Set Max Health.Description: Sets the Max Health property of the input combatant.

Combatant Split.Description: Splits the input Combatant into Player and AI types. Use this off of Combatant outputs to directly access the Player or AI.

i.Description: Put a comment next to your circuits to explain what they're doing.

Destination Room.Description: Configure this constant to choose a destination, specifying room, subroom, and welcome mat. If destination room is different than current room, only Entry Subrooms may be targeted. Party follow options may vary by destination. Use this chip with Go To Room.

Cos.Description: Computes the cosine of a number.

Costume Equip.Description: Equip a Player with a costume.

Rec Room Object Get All with Tag.Description: Searches the room for all objects with the input tag and outputs them as a list.

Rec Room Object Get Authority.Description: Outputs the authority Player of the input object.

Rec Room Object Get First with Tag.Description: Gets the first object with the input tag.

Rec Room Object Get Is Local Player Auth.Description: Outputs True on the player's machine who has authority of the input.

Rec Room Object Get Last Equipping Playe.Description: Returns the player who last held an object.

Rec Room Object Set Authority.Description: Sets the authority player of the input Rec Room Object.

Consumable Deactivate.Description: Sets the input consumable to inactive. Displays the consumable as not active in the backback and allow using another one.

Delay.Description: Fires outputs based on the inputted time to delay. The Run exec fires as soon as the node is executed. The After Delay exec fires once the input delay duration has completed. After Canceled fires after the delay node’s Cancel exec has been fired. Cancel cancels all current delays running from this node, except for delays scheduled for the next tick.

Destination Room Variable.Description: Stores a destination room. Destination cannot be configured from variable - for that, use a Constant.

Dice Get Player Rolled.Description: Returns the player who rolled the dice.

Dice Get Result.Description: Returns the result of the dice.

Dice Get Roll finished.Description: Outputs an exec when the dice finished rolling.

Distance.Description: Outputs the distance between the input objects.

Divide.Description: Find how many times a value contains another.

Emitter Get Looping.Description: Returns True if the target Emitter is looping.

Emitter Get Playing.Description: Returns True if the target Emitter is playing.

Emitter Get Size.Description: Returns the size multiplier of the target Emitter.

Emitter Get Speed.Description: Returns the speed multiplier of the target Emitter.

Emitter Set Color Id.Description: Sets the color for the particles emitted.

Emitter Set Color.Description: Sets the color for the particles emitted.

Emitter Set Looping.Description: Makes the emitter emit continuously or not.

Emitter Set Size.Description: Sets the size of the particles emitted.

Emitter Set Speed.Description: Sets the speed particles are emitted.

Equals.Description: Compares the two input values and outputs True if they are the same. False if they are different.

Event Receiver.Description: Events are the entry points for all circuit graphs. Events are execution hooks for things like a player loading into the room, or knowing when a Button is pressed. After creating this chip, make sure to use the configure tool to choose the event you want to listen for. You can use the Event Defintion chip to create your own events to add to this list and use with the Event Sender chip.

Event Sender.Description: Use the Event Sender to fire your custom events defined in Event Defintions. After creating this chip, make sure to use the configure tool to change the event that you want to fire. You can also change who you want to send the event to from the config menu.

Execution Integer Switch.Description: Executes the associated output of the compare value that matches the 'match' input. Executes the default output if no match can be found.

Execution String Switch.Description: Executes the associated output of the compare value that matches the 'match' input. Executes the default output if no match can be found.

float Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

Floor.Description: Returns the smallest integral value less than or equal to the input value.

Floor to Int.Description: Returns the smallest integer value less than or equal to the input value.

For Each.Description: Iterates over the input list. The loop exec fires for each element in the list. The Done exec fires once the end of the list has been reached.

For.Description: Iterates over the "From" pin (inclusive) to the "To" pin (exclusive).

From Rec Room Object.Description: Converts the input Rec Room Object to the object's subtype.

Get All Players.Description: Outputs a list of all the players in the room currently.

Get Authority.Description: Gets the authority player of the chip's current context.

Get Currency Balance.Description: Returns the local players balance of one room currency. Configure this chip to selecht which currency to use.

Get Broadcasting Attendance.Description: Outputs player counts if you're in an event that's actively broadcasting.

Outputs.Name: Audience Count
Outputs.Description: Number of players watching a broadcast at this event

Outputs.Name: Broadcaster Count
Outputs.Description: Number of players broadcasting themselves at this event

Outputs.Name: Is Broadcast Active
Outputs.Description: True if anyone is broadcasting. Only active broadcasts will have accurate attendance counts

Get Closest.Description: Finds the element in Targets that is closest in space to Origin, and returns it, its index in the list, and its distance to Origin.

List Get Element.Description: Gets a specified element from the input list. The "Index" is the location of the element in the list. The first element in the list is at index 0, the second element is at index 1.

Get Farthest.Description: Finds the element in Targets that is farthest in space to Origin, and returns it, its index in the list, and its distance to Origin.

Get Any Player with Role.Description: Gets a player with the role. Returns invalid player if no player has the role.

Get First Tag.Description: Gets the first tag of an object or player.

Get Formatted Time.Description: Returns the given universal time, formatted based on the C# DateTime format specifiers.

Get Forward Vector.Description: Gets the forward direction of a target, output as a vector.

List Get Count.Description: Outputs the number of elements inside the input list.

Get Local Camera Forward.Description: Gets the direction your avatar is looking, output as a vector3.

Get Local Camera Rotation.Description: Gets the rotation of your avatar's view, output as a quaternion.

Get Local Camera Up.Description: Gets the up direction from the local player's camera, output as a vector3.

Get Local Player.Description: Outputs the player running this chip on their machine.

Get Rotation.Description: Outputs the rotation of the target as a quaternion.

Get Party Of Player.Description: Returns the party of the input player as List<Player>. If the player is not in a party, it will return a list containing only that player.

Get Player Account Name.Description: Outputs the player's Account name (e.g Coach) in a form of a string. To get a display name, use To String.

Get Player By Account Name.Description: Gets a Player based on an Account Name. (E.g. my account name is @Coach and if I input the string "Coach", the output would be my Player object.) Outputs an invalid Player if nobody in the room has the given account name.

Get Player By Display Name.Description: Gets a Player based on a display name. (E.g. my display name is Coach and if I input a string "Coach", the output would be my Player object.) Outputs an invalid Player if nobody in the room has the given display name.

Leaderboard Get Player Stat.Description: Get leaderboard stat for the given player on stat channel 1, 2 or 3.

Get All Players With Role.Description: Outpus List<Player> that continues every player with the specified role.

Get Player World UI Enabled.Description: Returns the enabled state of the given player's world UI.

Get Player World UI Primary Bar Color.Description: Returns the color of the given player's primary bar in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Primary Bar Enabled.Description: Returns the enabled state of the given player's primary bar in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Primary Bar Max Valu.Description: Returns the max value of the given player's primary bar in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Primary Bar Value.Description: Returns the value of the given player's primary bar in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Secondary Bar Color.Description: Returns the color of the given player's secondary bar in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Secondary Bar Enable.Description: Returns the enabled state of the given player's secondary bar in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Secondary Bar Max Va.Description: Returns the max value of the given player's secondary bar in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Secondary Bar Value.Description: Returns the value of the given player's secondary bar in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Text Color.Description: Returns the color of the given player's text in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Text Enabled.Description: Returns the enabled state of the given player's text in their current world UI.

Get Player World UI Text Value.Description: Returns the value of the given player's text in their current world UI.

Get Position.Description: Outputs the position of the input object as a vector3.

Time Get Precise Seconds.Description: Gets the amount of seconds since a player launched Rec Room.

Get Room Authority.Description: Returns the player who is the room authority.

Time Get Universal Seconds.Description: Gets the number of seconds since 1970. Uses server's clock. This will be synchronized between players. This is also not guaranteed to be continuous. To measure time, use Time Get Precise Seconds instead.

Time Get Universal Time.Description: Gets the UTC time. Uses server's clock. This will be synchronized between players.

Get Tags.Description: Outputs a list of tags the input object or player has.

Player Get Time Zone.Description: Returns the offset of the given player's local time zone from UTC in seconds.

Time Get Unsynced Universal Seconds.Description: Gets the number of seconds since 1970. Uses local player's system clock. This is not synchronized between players! This is also not guaranteed to be continuous. To measure time, use Time Get Precise Seconds instead.

Time Get Unsynced Universal Time.Description: Gets the UTC time. Uses local player's system clock. This is not synchronized between players!

Get Up Vector.Description: Outputs the up direction of the input target, output as a vector3.

Get Velocity.Description: Returns the velocity of a Player or a Rec Room Object.

Go To Room.Description: Execution sends the specified player to a preconfigured destination. Use a destination constant or variable to specify the destination of this chip. Follow settings are a property of the destination.

Greater Than.Description: Returns True if input A is greater than input B.

Greater or Equal.Description: Returns True if input A is greater than or equal to input B.

Ground Vehicle Set Wheel Friction Multip.Description: Wheel Friction affects how good the wheels are at gripping the ground - lower values decrease traction and make the wheels slip more and higher values can increase traction and make the wheels slip less. 1 is the default value for Wheel Friction.

Inputs.Name: Friction multiplier
Inputs.Description: The lower this value is, the more the tires will slip instead of properly grabbing the ground

Has Tag.Description: Outputs True if the input object or player has the input tag.

HSV To Color.Description: Return a color from the given hue, saturation, and value inputs. All inputs are in the range [0, 1].

If Value.Description: Outputs one input value based on the input condition. Outputs the "Then" input if the input condition is True. Outputs the "Else" input if the input condition is False. Only reads one of the inputs, not both.

If Local Player Is Authority.Description: I'm Authority exec fires on the player's machine who has authority in the current context. At the room level, this is room authority, inside an object board, this is object authority. I'm Not Authority exec fires for everyone else.

If Local Player Is Room Authority.Description: I'm Authority exec fires on the player's machine who has authority over the room. I'm Not Authority exec fires for everyone else.

If Local Player Should Run.Description: The "Should Run" port will exec a) if the input player is local or b) if input player is invalid and the local player has authority of the current context.

If Player Is Local.Description: Outputs if a player is the local player or not.

Velocity Add.Description: Adds velocity to the input target. The input velocity will be multiplied by the magnitude of the vector provided in the input direction.

Velocity Reflect.Description: The input target's velocity parallel to the input direction vector is reflected along the input direction and velocities perpendicular to it, are maintained. The input velocity will be multiplied by the magnitude of the vector provided in the input direction.

Velocity Set.Description: Momentarily sets the velocity of the input target in the input direction. The input velocity will be multiplied by the magnitude of the vector provided in the input direction.

Interaction Volume Get Interaction Promp.Description: Gets the interaction promt of an Interaction Volume.

Interaction Volume Get Is Locked.Description: Returns False if the Interaction Volume is enabled, and True if it is locked.

Interaction Volume Set Interaction Promp.Description: Sets the interaction promt of an Interaction Volume.

Interaction Volume Set Locked.Description: Disables or enables an Interaction Volume (but reversed).

int Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

Int to Float.Description: Converts the input int to a float.

Invisible Collision Get Blocks Players.Description: Outputs True if the target Invisible Collision object is set to collide with players.

Invisible Collision Get Enabled.Description: Outputs True if the target Invisible Collision object is enabled.

Invisible Collision Set Blocks Players.Description: Sets the player collision state of a target Invisible Collision object.

Invisible Collision Set Enabled.Description: Sets the enabled state of a target Invisible Collision object.

Get Is Private Instance.Description: Returns True if the current room instance is private.

Is Valid.Description: Returns True if the input variable is not null. Certain variable types must be set before use because they can't have a default value. A Rec Room Object variable that isn't set isn't going to be valid.

Outputs.Name: Color
Outputs.Description: The color of the laser beam

Outputs.Name: Enabled
Outputs.Description: Whether the beam is on or off

Outputs.Name: Length
Outputs.Description: The length of the beam, in meters

Inputs.Name: Color
Inputs.Description: The color of the laser beam

Inputs.Name: Enabled
Inputs.Description: Whether the beam is on or off

Inputs.Name: Length
Inputs.Description: The length of the beam, in meters

Less Than.Description: Returns True if input A is less than input B.

Less or Equal.Description: Returns True if input A is less than or equal to input B.

Light Get Angle.Description: Returns the angle in degrees of the target Dome Light or Spotlight.

Light Get Color.Description: Returns the color of the target light.

Light Get Enabled.Description: Returns True if the target light is emitting light.

Light Get Intensity.Description: Returns the intensity of the target light.

Light Get Range.Description: Returns the range of the target light.

Light Get Softness.Description: Returns the softness value of the target light.

Light Get Specular Contribution.Description: Returns the specular contribution of the target light.

Light Set Angle.Description: Sets the angle of the spotlight's cone.

Light Set Color Id.Description: Sets the color for a point light or a spotlight.

Light Set Color.Description: Sets the color for a point light or a spotlight.

Light Set Intensity.Description: Sets the brightness level for a point light or a spotlight.

Light Set Range.Description: Sets the range of a point light or a spotlight.

Light Turn Off.Description: Turns off the point light or the spotlight.

Light Turn On.Description: Turns on the point light or the spotlight.

List Add.Description: Adds a new element to the end of the target list containing the input value.

List All True.Description: If all of the bool values in the list are True then return true.

List Any True.Description: If any bool value in the list is True then return True.

List<bool> Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

List<Color> Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

List Concat.Description: Combine lists together into one list.

List Contains.Description: Outputs True if the target list contains the input value.

List<Destination Room> Variable.Description: Stores a list of Destinations. Use constants to configure destinations.

List Divide.Description: Divides each element in the list by the next element.

List<float> Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

List Get All Indices Of.Description: Returns list of all indices of input item in target list if that list contains one or more instances of the item. Otherwise returns an empty list.

List Get First Index Of.Description: Returns first index of the item in target list if that list contains it. Otherwise returns -1.

List Insert.Description: Insert a new element into the target list at the input index. The new element contains the input value.

List<int> Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

List Max.Description: Outputs the highest value in the target list.

List Min.Description: Outputs the lowest value in the target list.

List Multiply.Description: Multiplies each element in the list by the next element.

List<Player> Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

List<Quaternion> Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

List Remove At.Description: Remove an element in the target list at the input index.

List Remove Last.Description: Removes the last element in a list.

List Shuffle.Description: Randomize the order of the values in the given list.

List Sort.Description: Sorts the given list in place in either ascending or descending order.

List<string> Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

List Subtract.Description: Subtracts each element in the list by the next element.

List Sum.Description: Adds each element in the list by the next element.

List<Vector3> Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

Log String.Description: Logs a string to the logging tab of your palette.

List Create.Description: Creates a list from input values. Add more inputs by using the configure tool on the node and press "Add Input". All items in a list must be of the same type.

Max.Description: Returns largest of two or more values.

Min.Description: Returns smallest of two or more values.

Modulo.Description: Outputs the remainder of the first value is divided by the second.

Multiply.Description: Multiplies the two or more input values and outputs the result.

Music.Description: Choose from a selection of music tracks, for use with the Audio Player.

Nand.Description: Outputs False only when all inputs are True. If any input is False, it outputs True.

Noise.Description: Samples a 3D Perlin noise field and returns a value usually bounded in [0,1].

Nor.Description: Outputs True when all inputs are False. Otherwise, outputs False.

Not.Description: Outputs the opposite of the input boolean.

Or.Description: Outputs True if any input is True. Otherwise outputs False.

Overlap Sphere.Description: Get information about all the objects/players within a certain distance of a point in space (position, distance, direction, etc.)

Parse Bool.Description: Converts the input string to a bool if able.

Parse Color.Description: Attempt to parse the given string as a hexadecimal color in the '#RRGGBB' format.

Parse Float.Description: Converts the input string to a float if able.

Parse Int.Description: Converts the input string to a integer if able.

Piston Get Acceleration.Description: Gets the acceleration of a piston.

Piston Get Distance.Description: Outputs the current distance of the target Piston.

Piston Get Target Distance.Description: Outputs the set distance of the Marker on a target Piston.

Piston Get Max Distance.Description: Outputs the max distance of the target Piston.

Piston Get Speed.Description: Returns the speed of a piston.

Piston Set Acceleration.Description: Sets the acceleration of the target Piston.

Piston Set Distance.Description: Moves the target piston to the input distance.

Piston Set Target Distance.Description: Sets the Marker distance of a target Piston.

Piston Set Max Distance.Description: Sets the max distance of a target Piston.

Piston Set Speed.Description: Sets the speed of a target Piston.

Player Add Role.Description: Adds a Role to a Player.

Player Definition Board.Description: This is very similar to an object board that you would find on any object, except this is for all players! After placing, make sure to configure it and make sure it is active. Edit into this board and add any other chips you'd like and know that each player will have the same logic on them when you hit done editing.

Player Get All with Tag.Description: Searches the room for all players with the input tag and outputs them as a list.

Player Get Dominant Hand Is Right.Description: Returns true if the given player has their right hand set as dominant.

Player Get Equipped Objects.Description: Gets equipped objects from a player.

Player Get First with Tag.Description: Gets the first player with the input tag.

Player Get Is Local.Description: Outputs True if the input player is the local player executing the chip on their machine.

Player Get Room Index.Description: Returns the unique index of this player in the room, bounded by the room capacity.

Player Has Role.Description: Outputs True if the input player has the input role.

Player Get Is Authority Of.Description: Outputs if a Player is authority of the input object.

Player Get Is Room Owner.Description: Outputs True if the input Player is one of the current room's owners.

Player Left Hand Finger Direction.Description: Outputs the direction of a Player's left hand finger.

Player Left Hand Rotation.Description: Outputs the rotation of a Player's left hand.

Player Left Hand Position.Description: Outputs the postion of a Player's left hand in world space.

Player Left Hand Thumb Direction.Description: Outputs the direction of a Player's left hand thumb.

Player Left Hand Velocity.Description: Outputs the velocity of a Player's left hand.

Player Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

Outputs.Name: On Player Owns Room Key Complete

Player Remove Role.Description: Removes the input role from a target player.

Player Right Hand Finger Direction.Description: Outputs the direction of a Player's right hand finger.

Player Right Hand Rotation.Description: Outputs the rotation of a Player's right hand.

Player Right Hand Position.Description: Outputs the postion of a Player's right hand in world space.

Player Right Hand Thumb Direction.Description: Outputs the direction of a Player's right hand thumb.

Player Right Hand Velocity.Description: Outputs the velocity of a Player's right hand.

Player Subscribes To Room Owner.Description: Outputs True if the input Player subscribes to one of the current room's owners.

Player World UI.Description: Define a set of world-space UI elements that can appear above a player.

Power.Description: Multiplies a value by itself an input number of times.

Prompt Local Player.Description: Sends a watch notification to a player. The player which it sends a notification to depends on who's machine fires the exec pin. Once this watch notification is opened, the player can type responses into the text box and send back responses. You can define the prompt title and the prompt itself via inputs, and can also receive the player’s response via an output pin.

Prompt Multiple Choice Player.Description: Sends a watch notification to the specified player containing the prompt title and body, along with each of the answer choices on its own line. Once this watch notification is opened, the player can choose a response and hit "ok," triggering the On Prompt Complete event. Since there is a delay between sending a notification and receiving the response in which other responses may be received, the Player output can be used to disambiguate multiple responses

Quaternion Create Angle Axis.Description: Creates a rotation which rotates "Angle" degrees around "Axis".

Quaternion Create Euler Angles.Description: Creates a quaternion from an input Vector3.

Quaternion Create From To.Description: Creates a rotation which rotates from "From" to "To".

Quaternion Create Look.Description: Creates a rotation with the specified forward and upwards directions.

Quaternion Create.Description: Manually create a quaternion. Congratulations, you have reached peak math.

Quaternion Dot.Description: The dot product between two rotations.

Quaternion Euler Angles.Description: Outputs the input quaternion as a vector3.

Quaternion Get Angle Axis.Description: Gets the rotation which rotates angle degrees around axis.

Quaternion Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

Quaternion Normalize.Description: Outputs the input quaternion with the same rotation but with a magnitude of 1.

Rotate Vector.Description: Rotate a Vector3 with a Quaternion.

Quaternion Slerp.Description: Spherically interpolates between quaternions "Start" and "End". Progress is 0 to 1. Also a rare, but refreshing beverage.

Quaternion Split.Description: Split a quaternion into its four float components: x, y, z, and w. Congratulations, you have reached peak math.

Random Float.Description: Generates a random float from ["Min" to "Max"]. "Min" is inclusive, and "Max" is also inclusive. For example with a "Min" of 0 and a "Max" of 1, both 0 and 1 have the possibility of getting output because they are both included in the range.

Random From List (Deprecated).Description: Outputs a random value from a target list.

Random Int.Description: Generates a random integer from ["Min" to "Max"]. "Min" is inclusive, and "Max" is also inclusive. For example with a "Min" of 0 and a "Max" of 1, 0 and 1 will have a chance of being output.

Raycast.Description: Fires an invisible ray from the "Start Position", in the "Direction" specified. Returns True if any object or player is hit within the target "Max Distance". Otherwise, returns False. You can configure the chip itself to ignore players or objects specifically.

Remove Tag.Description: Removes a tag from the input object or player.

Remove Tags.Description: Removes the input list of tags from the input object or player.

Reroute.Description: Used to remove spaghetti from your creations. Consumes additional CPU heat.

Reset Player World UI.Description: Reset the player's active world UI to its default values.

Respawn (Deprecated).Description: Sets the position and rotation of the target player or object. Players will rotate about the vertical axis only. Will fail in the following cases: If the target object is currently held, selected/frozen by the maker pen, or is the child of a gizmo. Will also fail on players that are seated.

Respawn.Description: Sets the position and rotation of the target player or object. Players will rotate about the vertical axis only. Will fail in the following cases: If the target object is currently held, selected/frozen by the maker pen, or is the child of a gizmo. Will also fail on players that are seated.

RGB To Color.Description: Return a color from the given red, green, and blue inputs. All inputs are in the range [0, 1].

Room Index Get Player.Description: Returns the player in the room with this unique index, bounded by the room capacity.

Rotator Get Target Rotation.Description: Outputs the rotation of the Marker on the target Rotator.

Rotator Get Rotation Acceleration.Description: Outputs the acceleration of a target Rotator.

Rotator Get Rotation.Description: Outputs the rotation of a target Rotator in degrees.

Rotator Get Rotation Speed.Description: Outputs the speed of a target Rotator.

Rotator Set Target Rotation.Description: Sets the rotation of the Marker on a target Rotator.

Rotator Set Rotation Acceleration.Description: Sets the acceleration of a target Rotator.

Rotator Set Rotation.Description: Sets the rotation of a target Rotator.

Rotator Set Rotation Speed.Description: Sets the speed of a target Rotator.

Round.Description: Rounds the input float to the nearest integral value.

Round to Int.Description: Rounds an input value to the nearest integer.

Sample Audio.Description: Record and store custom a custom audio sample, for use with the Audio Player.

Seat Get Lock Players In.Description: Returns True if the target Seat is set to lock players in.

Seat Get Lock Players Out.Description: Returns True if the target Seat is set to lock players out.

Seat Get Seated Player.Description: Outputs the currently seated player of a target Seat.

Seat Set Lock Players In.Description: Prevents a Seated player from unseating themselves on a target Seat. Use circuits to unseat or unlock.

Seat Set Lock Players Out.Description: Prevents players from sitting in a target seat.

Seat Set Seated Player.Description: Seats an input player on a target Seat.

Seat Unseat Player.Description: Unseats a currently seated player on a target Seat.

Self.Description: Outputs the object of the current context. For example, a self node inside a light outputs that specific light of the light type. This can only be placed inside an object board of a specific object or a player or object definition board.

Sequence.Description: Executes all output ports in order.

Set Camera Shake.Description: Start a screen shake effect for the given player. This will have no effect on VR players.

List Set Element.Description: Sets a value at a location in a list.

Leaderboard Set Local Player Stat.Description: Set leaderboard stat for the local player on stat channel 1, 2 or 3.

Set Player Vignette.Description: Apply a vignette of the given color to the given player. The vignette will be displayed at the given intensity for the given duration, and then fade out. The intensity must be between 0 and 1.

Display Player World UI.Description: Displays a target UI configuration above a given player.

Set Player World UI Primary Bar Color.Description: Set the color of the primary bar in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Primary Bar Enabled.Description: Set the enabled state of the primary bar in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Primary Bar Max Valu.Description: Set the max value of the primary bar in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Primary Bar Value.Description: Set the value of the primary bar in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Secondary Bar Color.Description: Set the color of the secondary bar in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Secondary Bar Enable.Description: Set the enabled state of the secondary bar in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Secondary Bar Max Va.Description: Set the max value of the secondary bar in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Secondary Bar Value.Description: Set the value of the secondary bar in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Text Color.Description: Set the color of the text in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Text Enabled.Description: Set the enabled state of the text in the given player's active world UI.

Set Player World UI Text Value.Description: Set the value of the text in the given player's active world UI.

Set Position (Deprecated).Description: Sets the position of the target player or object. Will fail in the following cases: If the target object is currently held, select/frozen by the maker pen, or is the child of a gizmo. Will also fail on players that are seated.

Set Position.Description: Sets the position of the target player or object. Will fail in the following cases: If the target object is currently held, select/frozen by the maker pen, or is the child of a gizmo. Will also fail on players that are seated.

Set Rotation.Description: Sets the rotation of the target player or object. Players will rotate about the vertical axis only. Will fail in the following cases: If the target object is currently held, select/frozen by the maker pen, or is the child of a gizmo. Will also fail on players that are seated.

Set Transform.Description: Sets the transform (position and rotation) of the target player or object. Players will rotate about the vertical axis only. Will fail in the following cases: If the target object is currently held, select/frozen by the maker pen, or is the child of a gizmo. Will also fail on players that are seated.

SFX.Description: Choose from a selection of SFX, for use with the Audio Player.

SFX Get Volume.Description: Outputs the volume of an SFX object.

SFX Play.Description: Plays a sound from an SFX object.

SFX Set Volume.Description: Sets the volume for an SFX object.

SFX Stop.Description: Stops the sound currently playing from an SFX object.

Show Notification.Description: Prints the input notification to the given player's screen.

Player Show Subtitle.Description: Displays a subtitle for a specified duration. If there is already a subtitle showing, it will be replaced only if this subtitle has an equal or higher priority. If the string is more than 200 characters, it will be displayed in multiple subtitles, each lasting a fraction of the total duration. Escape characters are ignored.

Sin.Description: Computes the sine of a number.

Skydome Constant.Description: Defines values for the room skydome.

Spherecast.Description: Fires an invisible sphere of the specified Radius from the Start Position, in the Direction specified. Returns true if any object or player is hit within the target Max Distance. Otherwise, returns false. You can configure the chip itself to ignore players or objects specifically.

Stop Camera Shake.Description: Stop any current screen shake for the given player.

String Concat.Description: Concatenate a given series of strings in order, with an optional separator.

String Contains.Description: Outputs True if the target string contains the input value.

String Format.Description: Use this chip to combine multiple strings together into a single string output. The "Format" input is part of final string output and can include other string inputs by using this syntax: {input pin # starting at 0}. For example, a "Format" input with a default value of “Hello, {0}!” with a single additional input pin with the value "World" is fully output as "Hello, World!". If you had another input pin you would use {1} to denote the 2nd pin. You can add more string inputs by configuring the chip and pressing "Add Input".

String Length.Description: Outputs the length of a target string in UTF-16 characters.

string Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

String Split.Description: Splits the target string at the input character.

String Split At Index.Description: Splits the target string in two at the input index.

String Index Of.Description: Outputs the index where the substring starts in the target string.

String To Lower.Description: Outputs the target string in lower case.

String To Upper.Description: Outputs the target string in upper case.

String Substring.Description: Allows you to extract individual parts from a string. You can think of this like a list of characters.

Subtract.Description: Takes one input value away from the other.

Sun Constant.Description: Defines values for the room's sun.

Tan.Description: Computes the tangent of a number.

Text Get Color.Description: Returns the color of the target Text gadget.

Text Get Text.Description: Outputs the visible text for a Text object.

Text Set Color Id.Description: Sets the color for a Text object.

Text Set Color.Description: Sets the color for a Text object.

Text Set Material.Description: Sets the material for a Text object.

Text Set Text.Description: Set the visible text for a Text object.

To Combatant.Description: Covert a player or an AI value into a Combatant value.

To Rec Room Object.Description: Casts a target specific object to a Rec Room Object.

Toggle Button Get Is Pressed.Description: Outputs True if the toggle button is pressed.

Toggle Button Set Is Pressed.Description: Sets a Toggle Button state to pressed.

To String.Description: Converts the input value to the string type. Example: the integer input 10 would output "10" as a string. Helpful for debugging purposes.

Trigger Handle Get Primary Action Held.Description: True if the primary action button is down; otherwise, False.

Trigger Volume Get Filter Role.Description: Gets the role name that is being used as a filter for a Trigger Volume.

Trigger Volume Get Filter Tags.Description: Gets the tags that are being used as a filter for a Trigger Volume.

Trigger Volume Get Object Count.Description: Gets the number of objects currently inside a Trigger Volume. This is not synchronized with the Trigger Volume's events!

Trigger Volume Get Player Count.Description: Gets the number of players currently inside a Trigger Volume. This is not synchronized with the Trigger Volume's events!

Trigger Volume Get Objects.Description: Gets all of the objects currently inside a Trigger Volume. This is not synchronized with the Trigger Volume's events!

Trigger Volume Get Players.Description: Gets all of the players currently inside a Trigger Volume. This is not synchronized with the Trigger Volume's events!

Trigger Volume Set Filter Role.Description: Sets the role name that is being used as a filter for a Trigger Volume.

Trigger Volume Set Filter Tags.Description: Sets the tags that are being used as a filter for a Trigger Volume. An object is considered by the Trigger Volume, if it has any of the tags in this list.

Value Integer Switch.Description: Returns the associated input of the compare value that matches the 'match' input. Returns the default value if no match can be found.

Value String Switch.Description: Returns the associated input of the compare value that matches the 'match' input. Returns the default value if no match can be found.

Vector3 Cross.Description: The cross product of two vectors results in a third vector which is perpendicular to the two input vectors.

Vector3 Dot.Description: Computes the dot product. Commonly used to determine if the camera is facing a particular direction.

Vector3 Variable.Description: Reads or writes a variable in the current scope based on the name.

Vector3 Normalize.Description: Outputs the target vector, but its magnitude is 1.

Vector3 Scale.Description: Multiplies a vector by a scalar.

Vector3 Create.Description: Creates a new vector from X, Y, Z values.

Vector Component Get Vector.Description: Gets the direction and magnitude of the Vector Component.

Vector Get Magnitude.Description: Outputs the length of the input vector.

Vector3 Split.Description: Breaks the X, Y, and Z values out of the input vector.

Welcome Mat Get Enabled.Description: Return whether target welcome mat is enabled (true) or disabled (false)

Welcome Mat Set Enabled.Description: Set target welcome mat to be enabled (true) or disabled (false)
